    • Method Detail

      • writeUnsignedByte

        protected void writeUnsignedByte(int length,
                     int value)
                          throws IOException
        Writes an unsigned byte value. This method doesn't check the validity of the value and writes the lower length bits in value.
        Parameters:
        length - bit length between 1 (inclusive) and 8 (inclusive).
        value - the value to write
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeBoolean

        public void writeBoolean(boolean value)
                  throws IOException
        Writes a 1-bit boolean value. Only one bit is used; 0x01 for true, 0x00 for false.
        Parameters:
        value - the boolean value to write
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • isNull

        protected boolean isNull(Object value)
                  throws IOException
        Writes a 1-bit boolean null flag for given value.
        Parameters:
        value - value whose null flag is written.
        Returns:
        true is given value is null and the value must not be serialized; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • isNotNull

        protected boolean isNotNull(Object value)
                     throws IOException
        Writes a 1-bit boolean null flag for given value.
        Parameters:
        value - the value be checked
        Returns:
        true if object is not null and should be serialized; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeBOOLEAN

        public void writeBOOLEAN(Boolean value)
                  throws IOException
        Writes a 1-bit Boolean value. FIrst, a 1-bit boolean value is written for null flag, And, if not null, the value is written via writeBoolean(boolean) with its booleanValue().
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeUnsignedShort

        protected void writeUnsignedShort(int length,
                      int value)
                           throws IOException
        Writes an unsigned short value. This method doesn't check the validity of the value and writes the lower length bits in value.
        Parameters:
        length - bit length between 1 (exclusive) and 16 (inclusive)
        value - value to write
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • writeUnsignedInt

        public void writeUnsignedInt(int length,
                    int value)
                      throws IOException
        Writes an unsigned int value. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if length or value is out of valid range.
        Parameters:
        length - bit length between 1 (inclusive) and 32 (exclusive)
        value - the unsigned int value to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeInt

        public void writeInt(int length,
            int value)
              throws IOException
        Writes a length-bit signed int.
        Parameters:
        length - bit length between 1 (exclusive) and 32 (inclusive).
        value - signed int value
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeUnsignedINTEGER

        public void writeUnsignedINTEGER(int length,
                        Integer value)
                          throws IOException
        Writes a length-bit unsigned Integer. First, a 1-bit boolean value is written for a null flag. And, if the value is not null, the value of intValue() is written via writeUnsignedInt(int, int) with specified length and the value's intValue().
        Parameters:
        length - the bit length; See writeUnsignedInt(int, int) for valid range.
        value - the value to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        writeUnsignedInt(int, int)

      • writeINTEGER

        public void writeINTEGER(int length,
                Integer value)
                  throws IOException
        Writes a length-bit signed Integer. First, a 1-bit boolean value is written for a null flag. And, if the value is not null, the value of intValue() is written via writeInt(int, int).
        Parameters:
        length - the bit length; See writeInt(int, int) for valid range.
        value - the value to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        writeInt(int, int)

        public void writeFLOAT(Float value)

        Parameters:
        value - value to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:

                     long value)
                       throws IOException
        Writes an unsigned long value.
        Parameters:
        length - bit length between 0x01 (inclusive) and 0x40 (exclusive)
        value - value to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeLong

        public void writeLong(int length,
             long value)
               throws IOException
        Writes a signed long value in length bits.
        Parameters:
        length - bit length between 1 (exclusive) and 64 (inclusive).
        value - value to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeUnsignedLONG

        public void writeUnsignedLONG(int length,
                     Long value)
                       throws IOException
        Writes a nullable unsigned Long value. First, a 1-bit boolean is written for a null flag. And, if value is not null, the value of longValue() is written via writeUnsignedLong(int, long).
        Parameters:
        length - the bit length
        value - the value to be written.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        writeUnsignedLong(int, long)

        value - the value to be written.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeDOUBLE

        public void writeDOUBLE(Double value)
                 throws IOException
        Writes a nullable Double value. First, a 1-bit boolean is written for a null flag. And, if value is not null, the value of doubleValue() is written via writeDouble(double).
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(byte[] value)
                throws IOException
        Writes a non-null byte array. First, a 31-bit unsigned integer is written for the byte count. And each byte is written.
        Parameters:
        value - the byte array to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • writeBYTES

        public void writeBYTES(byte[] value)
                throws IOException
        Writes a nullable byte array. First, a 1-bit boolean is written for a null flag. And, if the value is not null, the value is written via writeBytes(byte[]).
        Parameters:
        value - the byte array to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        writeBytes(byte[])

      • writeASCII

        public void writeASCII(String value)
                throws IOException
        Writes a 7-bit ASCII string. First, a 1-bit boolean is written for a null flag. And, if the value is not null, a 31-bit unsigned integer is written for the character count following all characters which each is written as 7-bit unsigned byte.
        Parameters:
        value - the ASCII string to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • writeUTF

        public void writeUTF(String value)
              throws IOException
        Deprecated. Not for Bit I/O. Use writeSTRING(String, String)
        Writes a UTF string. Identical to DataOutput.writeUTF(String).
        Parameters:
        value - string to write
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        DataOutput.writeUTF(String)

      • writeString

        public void writeString(String value,
               String charsetName)
                 throws IOException
        Writes a non-null String.
        Parameters:
        value - value to be written
        charsetName - charset name.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        writeBytes(byte[])

      • writeSTRING

        public void writeSTRING(String value,
               String charsetName)
                 throws IOException
        Writes a nullable String. First, a 1-bit boolean is written for a null flag. And, if value is not null, the value of getBytes(charsetName) is written via writeBytes(byte[]).
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be written
        charsetName - character set name to serialize the String
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        writeBytes(byte[])

        public int align(int length)
          throws IOException
        Aligns to given length as bytes.
        Parameters:
        length - the number of bytes to align
        Returns:
        the bits padded to align
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
